entry.title: Standard S/4HANA Approach for Leasing Account Determination Without Material or Service Master Data
entry.content:
Hi All,

Is there a standard way in SAP S/4HANA to derive a valuation class  and therefore the correct G/L account via OBYC , for leasing purchase orders without using a material master?

In our scenario, Procurement wants to create leasing POs using free-text or service (item category D) lines only. They do not want to create or duplicate material codes just to drive account determination. However, Finance requires that all leasing-related costs automatically post to a dedicated leasing G/L account for IFRS 16 reporting. This means we need a valuation class to be determined automatically in the PO, even though no material master is used.

Is there a standard S/4HANA configuration approach that allows: PO item category D (Service) No material number in the PO Automatic determination of valuation class based on something like material group Automatic G/L determination through OBYC (GBB/VBR) No enhancements, no BAdIs, no custom fields …essentially allowing Finance to get the correct leasing G/L while Procurement continues using text/service items?

If so, what configuration objects are involved, and are there specific dependencies (e.g., item category, account assignment category, plant, purchasing org) that must be maintained for this to work?”** what is tiltle of that?

entry.title: 運用開始後にチケット：3226691を適用した際の業務影響について。
entry.content:
運用を開始している会計年度バリアントに対して、チケット：3226691 の手順を実施した際の業務影響についてご教示ください。
《チケット内容》
・SE38でPGM（FINS_GENERATE_FISCAL_PERIOD ）を実施

《確認内容》
①実施が必要な会計年度バリアントと不必要な会計年度バリアントの違い（全部対応必要かどうか）
①実施時の業務影響の有無
②業務影響がある場合の詳細内容

entry.title: Chart of Accounts for foreign subsidiaries
entry.content:
Good morning SAP experts ,

We are rolling out our SAP customizations to our foreign subsidiaries , now we are facing a problem : 

In some of the countries , the accounting codes are already determined by government , these accounting codes are different with the chart of accounts of HQ . 

Our subsidiaries don't want to change their accounting codes after they start to use SAP , but the accounting department of HQ wants them to use the same chart of account , so that they can do the consolidation more easily .

Also , in our PL report of HQ , some accounts will appear at different lines based on the "Function Area" ,but some subsidiaries don't want to use "Function Area" , they just separate the account , so we cannot simply create a new chart of account for the subsidiaries and do the 1 on 1 mapping to the HQ chart of account .

  • Here is the question :
    Is there any method for our foreign subsidiaries keep using their accounting codes in SAP ,
    and HQ accounting department also can do the consolidation easily ?

Please help if you have any experiences or solutions , thank you very much .

Best regards

Shi Zhekui

entry.title: Supplier Name missing for AR01 report
entry.content: Currently for AR01, when you add Supplier and Supplier Name to the report through dynamic values, it will populate Supplier Number when available, but it does not populate the Supplier Name that goes with the Supplier Name.  Anyone have a solution for this?

entry.title: Missing "Payment details" tag in XML Facturae (public entity) - DRC SAP PUBLIC CLOUD
entry.content:
Hi everyone

We are working in this XML: ?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><fe:Facturae xmlns:fe="http://www.facturae.es/Facturae/2009/v3.2/Facturae">

We were trying to send an XML file to FACe. The procedure is now correct, and we can download the XML file and upload it to the FACe website (Spain).

Upon reviewing and comparing the format (with an older version of the client's ERP), we discovered that the <PaymentDetails> tag is missing. This tag contains the bank details where the company wishes to receive payment from the public entity.

Do I need to configure anything else for this bank information to appear in the XML file? I couldn't find any information on this. I tried including the bank details when creating the invoice and also added a custom bank to a business partner's profile, but nothing worked.

I followed the step by step from this website information: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a624a4a6d1d8473eb95fb42660127cfe/93f1698548a14c09947d53fbc1c3423a.html?locale=es-ES&version=2502.500

Thanks for the help!

entry.title: Error in Transaction OAYZ – Screen Layout Rule for Depreciation Area 01
entry.content: While executing transaction OAYZ, the system displays the following error message: “Maintain screen layout rule for dep.area 01 + asset class 1027 or deactivate it.”

entry.title: How to avoid accrual aggregation when a periodic ACE run is missed?
entry.content:
Hello, gurus!

What needs to be done so that on 31.03.2025 the system generates two separate documents for –1,000 each (for February and March), both with a posting date of 31.03.2025, instead of one aggregated document?

In the scenario shown in the table:

1. 01.01.2025, an accrual object (ACACTREE01) was created for 12,000 with a validity period from 01.01.2025 to 31.12.2025.

2. 31.01.2025, ACEPOSTINGRUN was executed for January — a posting document for –1,000 was created.

3. 28.02.2025, the periodic posting run for February was not executed (Missing!).

4. 31.03.2025, when ACEPOSTINGRUN was executed, the system created one document for –2,000 (covering both February and March).

entry.title: Asset sales in Colombia withholding tax
entry.content:
We are using sales order process for asset sales to calculate with holding taxes in Colombia company code where e-invoice process is used to submit details to Colombian tax authorities. But there is no option available to link the sales order to Asset master data to use it during asset retirement process.

 Please advise if there is any SAP notes/standard process to follow for asset sales in Colombia and tax reporting.

entry.title: Clarification on OB57 User Assignment and Impact of Deletion
entry.content:
Hello ,

We have been assigning accounting users to tolerance groups in OB57 for a long time. Our current process is to assign every new user in the accounting team to OB57.

Now, we are considering deleting all users from OB57. Before proceeding, I would like to understand:

  1. What is the impact if we delete all users from OB57?
  2. What is the impact of assigning users in OB57 versus not assigning them?

Thanks

entry.title: Incorrect behavior during White List verification after payment proposal
entry.content:
After executing a payment proposal in transaction F110, the SAP S/4HANA system verifies vendor data against the Polish VAT White List and the following issues occur:

  1. The system finds a bank account that is not listed on the White List.

    • Error message:
      VAT Payers List (Poland), bank account validation 0001: Does not exist on the White List.

entry.title: Validation for only employee without allowance is able to submit transportation claim in Concur
entry.content:
Hi All FI, SuccessFactors, and Concur Experts.

If we may know,
currently there is an inquiry from the end-user about the feasibility of set-up a kind of validation or restriction rule to only employee that receive "monthly transport allowance" will not be able to submit "taxi/transportation charges" claim via SAP Concur system.

Would you like to kindly help us on giving advice whether there is any specific technical field or information that we could use as such an indicator to know which personel number of employee that receive "monthly transport allowance" in SAP FI or SAP SuccessFactors? to be further integrated or acknowledged (captured) by the Concur system then.

Thank you so much, and we are looking forward to discussing this with you.

Ani.

@RafaelMira @Ronak_Jhuthawat @ctf_jacqting @Michaela_Sedlicka @LeoSupriano @katharina_sorge @yogeshgsalvi @harinarasimha @siddharthrajora

entry.title: Current Support Status of MultiCash Format in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
I hope you are doing well.

I am currently working on the configuration of Bank Statements and Bank Reconciliation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, and a question has come up regarding the MultiCash format.

During our setup, we noticed that the system fully supports and recommends the MT940 bank statement format; however, MultiCash does not appear as a selectable or predefined format in the standard configuration parameters of the Public Cloud Edition.

My questions for the community are:

  1. Is MultiCash officially supported in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508?

  2. If so, what is the expected process to enable or integrate this format, considering that it is not available in the standard bank statement import apps (e.g., Manage Bank Statements, Manage Incoming Payment Files)?

  3. Is SAP providing any recommended approach (e.g., Integration Suite mapping, alternative formats, or upcoming updates) for customers who still work with MultiCash and need to import these files into the Public Cloud environment?

I would really appreciate any guidance, official references, or insights based on experience with MultiCash in S/4HANA Cloud Public.

Thank you in advance!
